page.title: 04Buildings of Frome
page.content: Frome consists of a great number of listed buildings. Some appear to be in a bad state of disrepair, perhaps the most notable being the Grade 1 Rook Lane Congregational Church dated l707. Many others have been extensively renovated as seen in the Trinity area (l670-l720). A high proportion of all the listed buildings date from the l8th. cent., although some are from the l7th. cent. and even the 20th. cent. They serve various purposes, inc. ecclesiastical & residential. Although many buildungs retain much of their early charm, the vast majority of the listed ones have either been remodelled or altered since being constructed. The Bridge, widened & reconstructed in l82l is particularly striking with its shops. Year 2 (ll)
